channel.title: Tham Le's Notes
channel.description: Last 10 notes on Tham Le's Notes

item.title: WTF is a Windows Package Installer? EXE vs MSI
item.description: Understanding the difference between EXE and MSI installers, from PE format basics to the Windows Installer database

item.title: WTF is Device Topology on Linux?
item.description: Why your computer isn't a list of devices, but a complex family tree of buses, bridges, and controllers.

item.title: WTF is the Linux Input Core?
item.description: How the Linux kernel turns chaos into order by forcing every mouse, keyboard, and joystick to speak the same language.

item.title: WTF are Scancodes, Keycodes, and Virtual Keys?
item.description: Tracing the chaotic journey of a keystroke from hardware voltage to ASCII character.

item.title: WTF is evdev?
item.description: The universal protocol that lets your code listen to everything from a mouse to a PS5 controller without going insane.

item.title: WTF is hwdb?
item.description: The giant database of overrides that fixes your hardware's broken promises.

item.title: WTF is sysfs?
item.description: The virtual filesystem that turns Kernel C structs into files you can read and write.

item.title: WTF is udev?
item.description: The userspace device manager that decides what happens when you plug something in.

item.title: WTF are Safe IT Practices?
item.description: Comprehensive defense strategies against supply chain attacks, credential theft, and modern threats, learned from real incidents
